title: Helping My Friend Reform!
body: Basically, my friend who I play most of my league with gets pretty heated when he plays league. He has had some minor disciplinary actions taken against him(chat restrictions) but still has some toxic tendencies especially when we are in a particularly unfortunate game. I want to help him become more positive towards other people as I think it will help us win more games and make the experience for our teammates a bit better (also I don't want to lose my duo partner!) Any suggestions for helping a particularly stubborn player, or maybe if a riot member sees this they could get me some chat logs so I could show him some examples of what he needs to cut out!

replies.body: I don't really want to give out any of your friends personal chat logs, mostly just for personal security reasons, but I might have a few tips for them. Personally if I come across some rather....let's say passionate folks, I tend to either mute everyone or sometimes I'll even drag the entire chatbox off-screen. That way I can't be baited into an argument or anything like that, and I can also focus more on the game itself and communicate using pings.

thanks for the response! tbh these are recommendations that I have already given him.. I agree with the personal security thing, also why I didn't include his in-game name. This may be somewhat unorthodox but would you be able to send stuff to him through direct message? I'm guessing you are able to see what player I am talking about being the only player I have duo'd with?
We can't actually send direct messages to people like you're thinking. We'd have to add him in game just like normal players to DM them =\
